results.description: Uses rp_css_business (high user/alpha counts). Applied SUGGESTION1 by using a high-use field; SUGGESTION3: coverage 0.5 so applied ts_backfill to reduce missingness; SUGGESTION4 applied by choosing high userCount/alphaCount. SUGGESTION2 not applicable (not a vector). KEEP_IN_MINDs: implementation kept short (3 operators, 1 datafield). Confidence set to 0.75 because frequent usage and intuitive short-term reaction to business news.

Uses rp_nip_inverstor (high counts). Applied ts_backfill due to coverage<0.6. Multi-field suggestion not applied to keep implementation compact. Confidence 0.72 because investor-relations often precede price moves.

Uses nws18_ghc_lna (recommendation change). Applied ts_backfill; used ts_zscore to normalize across time. Kept simple (2 operators + datafield). Confidence 0.68 — recommendation changes are meaningful but noisy.
Combines rp_css_earnings with short-term change. SUGGESTION1 used (single high-use datafield). SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.74 — earnings sentiment is predictive around releases.
Uses rp_ess_mna (event sentiment for M&A). Applied ts_backfill and ts_arg_max to detect recent spikes. SUGGESTION4 satisfied by moderate userCount. Confidence 0.65 due to event-driven idiosyncrasy.

Two-field idea: difference between earnings and revenue composite sentiment. Applied SUGGESTION1 (two fields) and SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill both. KEEP_IN_MIND2: two datafields max. Confidence 0.78 — divergence often flags fundamental surprises.
Uses rp_css_price, measures persistence via ts_mean. Applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION4 considered. Confidence 0.66 — price-news alignment helpful but can be noisy.
Uses rp_nip_inverstor to find sharp jumps with ts_max-like behavior via ts_arg_max. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.70 due to predictive jump behavior.

results.idea: Analyst ratings vs price-target sentiment gap
results.description: Two-field gap: rp_ess_ratings minus rp_css_ptg. Applied ts_backfill to both. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.67 — rating/target divergence informative.
Uses rp_css_marketing; detect sustained negative via ts_mean and rank cross-sectionally with quantile. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.60 — marketing news has medium signal.
Uses rp_nip_price to capture projected impact. Applied ts_backfill and ts_zscore. Confidence 0.71 due to direct link to price.
Uses rp_ess_partner; applied ts_backfill and ts_delta. SUGGESTION4 moderate userCount used. Confidence 0.58 — partnership news often slow-moving.
Uses rp_nip_ptg to detect accelerating sentiment. Applied ts_backfill and ts_returns to measure pct-change. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Composite business sentiment trend vs recent jump
results.description: Two-stage: long-term mean vs recent delta on rp_css_business. Applied ts_backfill to field. Confidence 0.76 since business composite is robust.
Uses rp_ess_earnings to compute ts_ir (mean/std) for consistency of signal. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.73 — consistent earnings sentiment is reliable.
Uses rp_nip_revenue; detect negative shocks via ts_delta and quantile. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.69.
Uses rp_ess_insider to find outsized event sentiment using ts_arg_max. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.62 — insider news sometimes noisy but can precede moves.
Two-field: rp_ess_technical vs nws18_qmb (editorials). Applied ts_backfill both. SUGGESTION1 used two complementary fields. Confidence 0.55 — mixed signals from technical/editorial sources.
Uses rp_ess_product; measure persistence with ts_mean and ts_zscore. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.60.
Uses rp_css_price; compute ts_std_dev then inverse to favor low volatility sentiment stocks. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Earnings sentiment leading indicator vs ratings
results.description: Two-field: rp_css_earnings minus rp_ess_ratings (short lookback). Applied ts_backfill to both. Confidence 0.71 — earnings leading ratings is plausible.
Uses nws18_qcm (high-confidence news sentiment). Applied ts_backfill and ts_delta. SUGGESTION4 moderate counts considered. Confidence 0.68.
Two-field: rp_css_price vs rp_nip_inverstor. Applied ts_backfill both and computed difference. Confidence 0.73 — disagreement indicates upcoming adjustment.
Uses rp_nip_price with ts_decay_linear to favor recent impact. Applied ts_backfill. KEEP_IN_MIND satisfied: short implementation. Confidence 0.70.
Uses rp_css_inverstor; measured via ts_sum to capture cumulative recent positivity. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.66.
Two-field divergence: rp_css_marketing minus rp_ess_product. Applied ts_backfill both. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.52 — topical signals weaker.
Uses rp_ess_earnings and ts_ir to capture consistent winners. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.74.
Two-field: nws18_ghc_lna (recommendation changes) vs rp_css_earnings. Applied ts_backfill both and took delta. Confidence 0.69.
Uses nws18_event_relevance * rp_ess_earnings approximated via multiply. Two fields used; applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.72 since relevance weighting filters noise.
Uses nws18_event_similarity_days to penalize stale events by inverse days; applied ts_backfill and inverse. Confidence 0.55 — novelty matters but measurement noisy.
Uses nws18_qmb; applied ts_backfill and ts_zscore. Confidence 0.60.
Two-field: rp_css_ptg minus rp_ess_ratings. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.63.
Uses rp_ess_legal to capture negative legal events via ts_delta and quantile. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.59.
Uses rp_css_credit_ratings; applied ts_backfill and ts_zscore. Confidence 0.61.
Uses rp_css_dividends (low userCount) but applied ts_backfill anyway and ts_delta. SUGGESTION4 noted lower counts reduce confidence. Confidence 0.50.
Uses rp_css_revenue; applied ts_backfill and ts_mean to smooth. Confidence 0.70.
Uses rp_nip_product; ts_returns used to find acceleration. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.62.
Uses rp_css_equity; applied ts_backfill and ts_delta. Confidence 0.58.
Uses rp_nip_inverstor and ts_sum to capture build-up. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.68.
Uses rp_nip_marketing; ts_delta and quantile applied. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.54.
Uses rp_ess_society; contrarian via reverse(ts_mean). Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.48 — social topics less tied to price.
Uses rp_ess_technical to detect technical-sentiment spikes with ts_arg_max. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.56.
Uses rp_css_assets; applied ts_backfill and ts_zscore. Confidence 0.62.
Uses rp_nip_credit and ts_ir to measure stable credit impact. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.60.
Uses rp_nip_insider and ts_sum to capture multiple insider signals. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.63.
Two-field: rp_ess_legal minus rp_ess_ratings. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.57.
Multiply nws18_qcm (high-confidence sentiment) by rp_ess_earnings to focus on reliable earnings news. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.75.
Uses rp_nip_price and ts_std_dev to find increasing dispersion. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.65.
Uses ts_decay_linear on rp_css_earnings to emphasize recent sentiment. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.72.
Uses nws18_ghc_lna (rating changes) with ts_returns to capture momentum. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.66.
Uses nws18_bam and ts_mean to capture sustained M&A sentiment. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.61.
Uses rp_css_earnings with ts_max_diff to flag large current deviations. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.69.
Two-field: rp_css_ptg minus rp_css_price. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.64.
Uses nws18_qmb and ts_delta to detect negative editorial shifts. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.58.
Uses rp_nip_ratings to capture accelerating rating-related impact via ts_returns. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.67.
Two-field: rp_css_revenue minus rp_css_price. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.70.
Multiply rp_ess_partner by nws18_event_relevance to emphasize relevant partnership news. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.66.
Uses ts_count_nans on nws18_qmb after backfill to approximate frequency (low count -> higher NaNs). Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.49 — indirect proxy, lower confidence.
Two-field: rp_ess_product vs rp_nip_inverstor difference. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.61.
Uses ts_rank over rp_css_earnings to find relative standing in time. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.65.
Uses rp_css_ratings with ts_delta and zscore. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.68.
Uses rp_css_business and nws18_qmb multiplied to weight editorial by business composite. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.67.
Two-field: nws18_ghc_lna minus rp_nip_inverstor. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.64.
Uses rp_nip_ptg ts_delta to spot falling expectations. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.60.
Uses rp_css_revenue with ts_ir to find consistent performers. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.66.
Uses rp_nip_mna and ts_sum to capture multi-day build-up. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.63.
Two-field: nws18_qmb minus rp_css_business. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.58.
Uses ts_arg_max on rp_css_price to find most recent peak. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.65.
Two-field: rp_css_ratings minus rp_css_credit_ratings. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.62.
Uses rp_nip_inverstor and ts_zscore to normalize recent projections. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.71.

results.idea: Product positive spike with price relevance
results.description: Multiply rp_ess_product by rp_ess_price to find product news that mentions price. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.64.
Uses winsorize-like approach by applying ts_zscore then tail via quantile on rp_css_earnings. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.68.
Uses rp_nip_marketing and ts_sum to detect accumulation. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.55.
Uses rp_css_ptg with ts_mean to capture persistent target movement. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.63.
Uses rp_nip_legal with ts_arg_max to capture sudden legal impact. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.58.
Uses rp_css_partner normalized by ts_zscore after backfill. Confidence 0.61.
Two-field: rp_nip_inverstor minus nws18_qmb. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.60.
Uses ts_arg_min on rp_css_earnings to find recent troughs (mean-reversion). Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.67.
Uses reverse of ts_mean of rp_css_price to create contrarian exposure. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.59.
Two-field: rp_ess_ratings minus rp_ess_product. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.56.
Uses nws18_event_similarity_days inverse to boost novel earnings news. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.63.
Uses rp_nip_ratings with ts_sum to accumulate rating-impact signals. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.65.
Uses ts_max_diff on rp_ess_earnings to spot overreaction. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.70.
Uses rp_css_credit with ts_delta and quantile. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.58.
Two-field: rp_nip_inverstor minus rp_nip_revenue. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.66.
Uses rp_css_business (as editorial proxy) ts_ir to find consistent editorial drivers. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.64.
Uses ts_arg_max on rp_ess_product to detect most recent spike. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.61.
Two-field: ts_sum of rp_css_price minus ts_sum of nws18_qmb. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.62.
Select long contrarian on sustained negative rp_css_earnings via ts_sum negative. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.67.
Multiply nws18_ghc_lna by nws18_event_relevance to overweight relevant rating changes. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.70.
Two-field: rp_ess_partner minus rp_css_marketing. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.54.
Apply ts_decay_linear to rp_css_price after backfill to favor recent price related news. Confidence 0.68.
Two-field: rp_css_earnings minus rp_ess_product. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.65.
Uses ts_arg_min on rp_nip_inverstor to capture recent low investor-impact days (mean reversion). Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.60.
Two-field: difference between rp_css_revenue and rp_css_earnings; small difference signals alignment. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.66.
Uses nws18_qcm and ts_sum to accumulate high-confidence editorial signals. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.63.
Two-field: rp_ess_technical minus rp_css_price. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.59.
Multiply nws18_event_relevance by rp_nip_inverstor to emphasize relevant investor-impact events. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.71.
Simple normalization of rp_css_price via ts_zscore after ts_backfill. Applied SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.69.
Use ts_count_nans on rp_ess_earnings after backfill to gauge sparsity (inverse proxy for event frequency). Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.50.
Two-field: rp_nip_ratings minus rp_nip_price. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.63.
Two-field: rp_css_business minus rp_css_revenue to find businesses with sentiment not driven by top-line. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Analyst change multiplied by earnings sentiment
results.description: Multiply nws18_ghc_lna by rp_css_earnings to overweight rating changes on earnings contexts. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.72.
Uses ts_arg_max on rp_nip_ptg to detect recent large jumps. Applied ts_backfill. Confidence 0.62.
Two-field: rp_ess_product minus rp_css_ptg. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Earnings sentiment vs event relevance gap
results.description: Two-field: rp_css_earnings minus nws18_event_relevance (after backfill) to find earnings with low media relevance. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.60.
Multiply ts_sum(nws18_qmb) by ts_sum(rp_nip_inverstor) to find coordinated build-ups. Applied ts_backfill both. Confidence 0.65.
